body_html: So I actually don't think it's a very good idea. I don't like it that sometimes we allow this, sometimes not. Right now we're having this nice notation of module.child.child2.weight, so it would be nice if you could (re)assign everything on arbitrary nesting level. On the other hand I agree it's nice to keep such temporary state in containers, even though it makes things a more messy (e.g. with serialization or forgetting to call .reset()).

body: So I actually don't think it's a very good idea. I don't like it that sometimes we allow this, sometimes not. Right now we're having this nice notation of `module.child.child2.weight`, so it would be nice if you could (re)assign everything on arbitrary nesting level. On the other hand I agree it's nice to keep such temporary state in containers, even though it makes things a more messy (e.g. with serialization or forgetting to call `.reset()`).
